channel.title: Runserver/runclient errors
channel.description:
Okay so heres my problem.. Everytime i download a server of any type(317,508,562) on my windows 7 64-bit i get an error when i run the client, which i will post below, and also when i compile my server then run my server again i get an error. Which i will post below.
Client error: [IMG]http://i1149.photobucket.com/albums/o591/tisko1/error.jpg[/img]
run code for client: [IMG]http://i1149.photobucket.com/albums/o591/tisko1/clientruncode.jpg[/img]
source runs fine before compiling the source, but this is what happens when compiled. [IMG]http://i1149.photobucket.com/albums/o591/tisko1/sourcecompileerror.jpg[/img]
If you need any other info comment below, yes i have used google. So if you could help i would be happy :) Also, remember this happens on every server i download/use not just one.. :c and if this is an easy fix, i am a noob so sorry for that lol

item.title: Runserver/runclient errors
item.dc:creator: @CiTyWoK CiTyWoK
item.description:
@CiTyWoK wrote:

yeah i have a JDK folder, it says 1.7.0.0_3 and i tried the first code u posted for compiler but it does this:

is that what its supposed to do, or what?:o and if it is supposed to do that, the run server still gets that error.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver/runclient errors
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Go to c:/Program Files/Java it should tell you which version your JDK it is. If it’s 1.7.0.0_3, try this:

@echo off
Title Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

and if it’s 1.7.0_04 try this one:

@echo off
Title Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_04\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

If you don’t see any JDK folder in your Java folder, then download it here: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk-7u3-download-1501626.html
get the x86 if you’re running 32-bit or x64 if you’re running 64-bit. See if that helps.

Read full topic
